TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract IPSWorkflowService

Docs.summary: An interface that enables workflow activities to integrate with Project Server functionality.

remarks.para: The methods defined in IPSWorkflowService are implemented in the class.

Docs.param: Information that is related to the current instance of the workflow that is being processed.
The GUID of the queue job.
Docs.summary: Returns the current queue completion state of the specified queue job.
Docs.returns: The job completion state for the specified job.

remarks.para: The job completion state can be used to determine whether the queue job has completed processing.

The GUID of the workflow stage to check.
True if the current stage is set to wait always, even if there are no required fields; otherwise, false.
Docs.summary: Checks whether there are required custom fields or business drivers.
Docs.returns: True if there are required custom fields; otherwise, false.

Docs.param: Information that is related to the current instance of the workflow that is being processed.
True if there is an error in the workflow; otherwise, false.
Docs.summary: Marks a workflow stage as completed, or completed with errors.

remarks.para: The CleanupAfterWF method is used when the workflow completes a stage or when it encounters an error.

MemberSignature.Usage: iPSWorkflowService.CompareProjectProperty (workflowContext, propertyName, mdPropUid, compareOperator, textPropertyValue, numericPropertyValue, dateTimePropertyValue, durationPropertyValue, flagPropertyValue, codePropertyValue)

Docs.param: Information that is related to the current instance of the workflow that is being processed.
The name of the project property. If is not a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) and is not empty, is ignored.
The GUID of the custom field to be compared.
The comparison operation to be performed, specified by a constant.
The text value that is used in the comparison. If the property is not a text value, is ignored.
The numeric value that is used in the comparison. If the property is not a numeric value, is ignored.
The DateTime value that is used in the comparison. If the property is not a DateTime value, is ignored.
The duration value that is used in the comparison. If the property is not a duration value, is ignored.
A Boolean value that is used in the comparison. If the property is not a Boolean value, is ignored.
A code value (such as the GUID of a selection in a lookup table) that is used in the comparison. If the property is not a code value, is ignored.
Docs.summary: Compares the value of the specified project property with the supplied value.
Docs.returns: The result of the comparison operation.

remarks.para: The comparison is based on the type of the specified project property.

MemberSignature.Value: public int GetEventSubscriptionCount (Microsoft.Office.Project.Server.Library.ProjectWorkflowContext workflowContext, Guid instanceUid, string eventName, Guid correlationId);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance int32 GetEventSubscriptionCount(class Microsoft.Office.Project.Server.Library.ProjectWorkflowContext workflowContext, valuetype System.Guid instanceUid, string eventName, valuetype System.Guid correlationId) cil managed
Public Function GetEventSubscriptionCount (workflowContext As ProjectWorkflowContext, instanceUid As Guid, eventName As String, correlationId As Guid) As Integer
public: int GetEventSubscriptionCount(Microsoft::Office::Project::Server::Library::ProjectWorkflowContext ^ workflowContext, Guid instanceUid, System::String ^ eventName, Guid correlationId);
abstract member GetEventSubscriptionCount : Microsoft.Office.Project.Server.Library.ProjectWorkflowContext * Guid * string * Guid -> int

Docs.param: Information that is related to the current instance of the workflow that is being processed.
The GUID of the workflow instance.
The name of the event.
The GUID of the correlation identifier of the event. The correlation identifier can be used to uniquely identify an event within a workflow instance.
Docs.summary: Gets the total number of subscriptions for the specified workflow instance, event name, and correlation identifier combination.
Docs.returns: The number of subscriptions to the event.

remarks.para: Activities that provide a workflow consumable event should use the GetEventSubscriptionCount method to determine whether there are any active subscribers for the event. If there are no subscriptions for the event, the activity can choose to not raise the event.

The GUID of the security group.

MemberSignature.Value: public void RegisterForEvent (Microsoft.Office.Project.Server.Library.ProjectWorkflowContext workflowContext, Guid instanceUid, string eventName, Guid correlationId, Guid subscriptionUid);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void RegisterForEvent(class Microsoft.Office.Project.Server.Library.ProjectWorkflowContext workflowContext, valuetype System.Guid instanceUid, string eventName, valuetype System.Guid correlationId, valuetype System.Guid subscriptionUid) cil managed
Public Sub RegisterForEvent (workflowContext As ProjectWorkflowContext, instanceUid As Guid, eventName As String, correlationId As Guid, subscriptionUid As Guid)

public: void RegisterForEvent(Microsoft::Office::Project::Server::Library::ProjectWorkflowContext ^ workflowContext, Guid instanceUid, System::String ^ eventName, Guid correlationId, Guid subscriptionUid);
abstract member RegisterForEvent : Microsoft.Office.Project.Server.Library.ProjectWorkflowContext * Guid * string * Guid * Guid -> unit

Docs.param: Information that is related to the current instance of the workflow that is being processed.
The GUID of the workflow activity instance.
The name of the event that is being registered.
The GUID of the correlation identifier of the event. The correlation identifier can be used to uniquely identify an event within a workflow instance.
The GUID that is supplied by the caller to register for the event. The registration is defined by the specified instance, event name, and correlation identifier.
Docs.summary: Registers a workflow activity for an event that is raised for the workflow.

remarks.para: Project Server workflows integrate with the SPWorkflowExternalDataExchangeService to support raising events within the workflow.

Events that do not need to be uniquely identified within the workflow can use the workflow instance identifier for the correlation identifier. For example, the OnProjectSubmit event uses the workflow instance identifier as the correlation identifier.

Specifies whether to delete the custom field value (true to delete; otherwise, false).
The GUID of the queue job.
